title: NOTE: This class only produces fairly low-quality pseudo-random numbers, and should never be used to generate random numbers for cryptographic operations or other situations where higher-quality randomness is critical (For that, you would want to use the
SecureRandom
c
class, as noted below). An explanation for the distinction between “secure” and “insecure” randomness is beyond the scope of this example.
